entry.title: Global Variables in Ruby
entry.content:
There are five kinds of variables in Ruby:

  • Global – stored globally
  • Local – stored lexically
  • Instance
  • Class
  • Constant

Global variables:

These are incredibly easy to use (I see sooo many games of Tic Tac Toe with global variables written by Ruby beginners), but also quite easy to abuse. I see a lot of code written by absolute beginners where global variables are used heavily because it is a lot harder to think of correct scope.

Over-using them probably means that app was not thoroughly thought out.
